result.execSummary:
The defendant Domonic J Coon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Jensen advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Case called at 9:12 AM 
Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Domonic J Coon in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
20 DAYS JAIL
CREDIT TIME 20-DAYS
COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED

COSTS: $243.00
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Defendant has addition credit time.  Court applies $75.00 for each day.  Court applies 6-days credit.  Costs/DNA Surcharges are considered paid in full.*
